014package org.jdbi.v3.sqlobject.customizer.internal;
015
016import java.lang.annotation.Annotation;
017import java.lang.reflect.Method;
018import java.time.Clock;
019import java.time.OffsetDateTime;
020import java.time.ZoneId;
021import java.util.function.Function;
022
023import org.jdbi.v3.meta.Beta;
024import org.jdbi.v3.sqlobject.customizer.SqlStatementCustomizer;
025import org.jdbi.v3.sqlobject.customizer.SqlStatementCustomizerFactory;
026import org.jdbi.v3.sqlobject.customizer.Timestamped;
027import org.jdbi.v3.sqlobject.customizer.TimestampedConfig;
028
029public class TimestampedFactory implements SqlStatementCustomizerFactory {
030    private static Function<ZoneId, Clock> timeSource = Clock::system;
031
032    @Override
033    public SqlStatementCustomizer createForMethod(Annotation annotation, Class<?> sqlObjectType, Method method) {
034        final String parameterName = ((Timestamped) annotation).value();
035
036        return stmt -> {
037            ZoneId zone = stmt.getConfig(TimestampedConfig.class).getTimezone();
038            stmt.bind(parameterName, OffsetDateTime.now(timeSource.apply(zone)));
039        };
040    }
041
042    /**
043     * for testing purposes only
044     */
045    @Beta
046    static void setTimeSource(Function<ZoneId, Clock> timeSource) {
047        TimestampedFactory.timeSource = timeSource;
048    }
049}
